intro: Trevoa trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined trevoa, is a member of the Malvaceae family, native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that typically have three distinct veins. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Trevoa trinervis is adapted to grow in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
